H0.text: What American animal is commonly called an antelope, but is not actually an antelope. Mule Deer

H1.text: What American animal is commonly called an antelope, but is not actually an antelope. Bighorn Sheep

H2.text: What American animal is commonly called an antelope, but is not actually an antelope. Mountain Goat

H3.text: What American animal is commonly called an antelope, but is not actually an antelope. Pronghorn

A4.text: Though not an antelope, it is known colloquially in North America as the American antelope, prong buck, pronghorn antelope, and prairie antelope, because it closely resembles the antelopes of the Old World and fills a similar ecological niche due to parallel evolution.

A5.text: The pronghorn's horn sheaths that branch and have a forward-pointing tine, unlike the horns of species from the ox family Bovidae.
